Description: A string composed of long, standard and short truncated convex bicone beads, some barrels and spherical beads, all of garnet and roughly graded in size, and a single green glazed composition disc bead.
Curator's comments: Although it has been suggested (M. Vilímková, ‘Egyptian Jewellery’ (London, 1969), pl.21f) that in such strings (which appear to be composed completely of garnet beads) the damaged beads are really of glass or a glazed substance, no evidence has been found from examination of beads in this entry to confirm this supposition.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (523)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
